sentence.text: A moderate to severe reduction (AAAA50%) in positive regulation of cell death activity resulting from recessive deletions and/or missense mutations has been shown to cause cardiac muscle tissue development 1 hyperprolinemia (HPI).

Here we studied the frequency of a recurrent small 22q11.2 deletion encompassing positive regulation of cell death and the neighboring cell adhesion gene in three case-control studies, one comprising HPI patients (n = 83), and the other two comprising autism spectrum disorder (ASD) patients (total of n = 2800), analyzed with high-resolution microarrays.
